Literature.Title: The Ancestral N-Terminal Domain of Big Defensins Drives Bacterially Triggered Assembly into Antimicrobial Nanonets
Literature.Author: Loth K, Vergnes A, Barreto C, Voisin SN, Meudal H, da Silva JL, Bressan A, Belmadi N, Bachère E, Aucagne V, Cazevielle C, Marchandin H, Rosa RD, Bulet P, Touqui L, Delmas AF, Destoumieux-Garzón D

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Aliivibrio fischeri(MIC=>10µM),Burkholderia multivorans(MIC=>10µM),Escherichia coli MC4100(MIC=>10µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 9027(MIC=>10µM),Pseudomonas aeruginosa(MIC=>10µM),Vibrio tasmaniensis(MIC=>10µM),Vibrio crassostreae(MIC=5µM),Vibrio orientalis(MIC=>10µM),Vibrio breoganii(MIC=20µM),Vibrio harveyi(MIC=>10µM),Corynebacterium stationis CIP 101282(MIC=2.5µM),Microbacterium maritypicum CIP 105733T(MIC=10µM),Micrococcus luteus CIP 5345(MIC=10µM),Staphylococcus aureus MR(MIC=>10µM),Staphylococcus aureus Newman(MIC=>10µM),Staphylococcus aureus SG511(MIC=>10µM)
